wms_article.title: KOAS shares hit intraday high on Novelty Nobility acquisition news

wms_article_body.body: Office furniture maker KOAS saw its shares surge to a record high during Monday morning trading after the company announced plans to acquire antibody drug developer Novelty Nobility, marking its entry into the pharmaceutical and biotechnology sector. According to the Korea Exchange, the shares were trading at 12,700 won as of 9:24 a.m., up 12.69 percent from the previous session. The stock climbed as high as 14,650 won earlier in the session to set a new intraday high. KOAS disclosed on August 22nd, 2025, that it will acquire 2.44 million shares of Novelty Nobility for around 15 billion won ($10.9 million), giving it a 14.3 percent stake. The share purchase is scheduled to be completed on September 8th, and the company said the purpose of the acquisition is to “maximize synergy between the two firms in connection with our planned entry into new drug development as well as the biopharma sector.” For its part, medical device maker Graphy saw its stock tumble on its first day of trading on the Kosdaq. The shares were changing hands at 11,700 won as of 9:14 a.m., down 22 percent from the offering price of 15,000 won. Graphy is the world’s first company to commercialize a shape-memory transparent orthodontic device (SMA), which automatically adheres to teeth when applied in the mouth and has obtained certifications from both the European Union (CE) and the U.S. Food and Drug Administration. The offering price was set at 15,000 won, below the initial target range of 17,000 to 20,000 won. KOAS shares closed at 10,900 won, while Graphy shares closed at 11,260 won.
